results.title: Around Australia. No. 1. South-west corner
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dennis Hill Productions
results.brief_description: Two hundred miles south of the Western Australian capital of Perth stands Cape Leeuwin Lighthouse. We see something of the life of farmers in the district who run beef and dairy cattle nearby, whilst for the visiting tourists there is fishing, birdwatching, and exploration of the limestone caves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dennis Hill Productions

results.title: Around a gum tree
results.creator_credit: Shell Oil Company, Geoffrey Bell, David Bilcock and Owen Brothers Animated Films
results.brief_description: Shows examples of Australia’s many varieties of gum trees growing in their natural surroundings. The way people live in the different types of country is described in addition to the main story of the gum trees themselves.

results.title: Arou
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
In this film, a map locates Arou, a tribal area of the Duna people, in the New Guinea highlands between the Central and Muller Ranges. The traditional economy of the people is shown to be almost self-sufficient. Sweet potatoes are the staple food and pigs are the main form of wealth. The lifting of entry restrictions in 1964 allowed European contact to be made with these people and the resulting changes in the economy and some problems now facing the Duna people are revealed. Suitable for Social Studies and Geography. No other credits available.

results.title: Aroha Bridge

constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

results.title: Aroha
results.brief_description: Through the story of Aroha, daughter of a Maori chieftan, we see how the Maori people of New Zealand are integrating their ancient tribal customs with the ways of their non-Maori neighbours and progressing toward a fuller equality as citizens of New Zealand. Aroha, a student of Wellington University, is able to bring her people to a greater acceptance of the non-Maori’s ways when her father is brought back to health in a modern hospital. Depicts Maori customs and concludes with tribal dances. No other credits available.

results.title: Arnold
results.creator_credit: Ron Headford Productions and Ron Headford
results.brief_description: Shows the familiar orators on the banks of the Yarra on a typical Sunday afternoon in Melbourne. Using still photographs, plus an actual sound recording of the orator and the interjections of the crowd, it provides an interesting glimpse of the orator and the people who gather round him. Photographer: Barrie Bell.

results.title: Arnhem Land (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Charles P. Mountford
results.brief_description: Records the 1948 joint Australian-American expedition to Arnhem Land. Shows field work of scientists collecting specimens of insects, birds, fish, mammals, flowers, vegetation, rock structures, aboriginal paintings and carvings, etc. Several scenes show aborigines in ceremonial rituals, including the dances of the great kangaroo, the water snake, and the wild honey dances. Photographed by Peter Bassett-Smith, with music by Alfred F. Hill.

results.title: Army ordnance
results.brief_description: Describes the functions of Ordnance in the Australian Army; how it supplies ammunition, transport, clothing, etc. Explains how equipment is manufactured by private firms and is thoroughly checked by Ordnance men before being sent to depots for storage. Shows the procedure for dealing with an order from receipt to final despatch.

results.title: Army eagles
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Peter Spender
results.brief_description: This documentary tells of the important role aviation plays by the Army in serving the ground forces pointing out the versatility of helicopters and light aircraft.
